topic.title: Adding Video, Audio, and Embedded HTML Resources
topic.shortdesc: Adding video, audio, and embedded HTML resources to your DITA, DocBook, or XHTML topics allows you to create engaging and interactive content. Supported media types include mp3, wav, m4a, mp4, and embedded videos using iframe code. In Author mode, the media objects are rendered and can be played directly, while in the publishing stage, they are converted to HTML5 elements for proper rendering in all HTML5-based outputs.

body.p: In your DITA, DocBook, or XHTML topics, you have the ability to add media resources such as videos, audio clips, or embedded HTML frames. These resources can be played directly in "Author" mode and in all HTML5-based outputs. To add a reference to a media resource, you can use a handy toolbar button. You can also simply drag media files from your system explorer or the Project Explorer view and drop them into your documents, or copy and paste them. This makes it easy to include engaging media content in your topics. So go ahead and enhance your content by adding videos, audio clips, or HTML frames to make it more interactive and exciting for your readers.

section.title: Adding a Media Resource
section.p: To insert a media resource in a document, use the following procedure:

ol.li: Place the cursor at the location where you want the media resource.

Select the Insert Media Resource action from the toolbar. A Chose Media dialog box appears.You can also drag media files from your system explorer or the Project Explorer view and drop them into your documents (or copy and paste them).
Select the URL for the media resource and click Ok.

section.p: Result in Author Mode: A reference to the specified media object is inserted and rendered in Author mode so that it can be played directly from there.
Result in Output: In the publishing stage, the media object is converted to an HTML5 element so that it can be rendered properly and played in all HTML5-based outputs.
